p: Coronaviruses (CoVs) were first identified in 1960 ( Kahn and McIntosh, 2005) and were classified as members of the family Coronaviridae. CoVs are enveloped, single-stranded RNA viruses with a genome varying from 25 to 32 kb ( Payne, 2017). The viral structure is primarily formed by the structural spike (S), membrane (M), envelope (E), and nucleocapsid (N) proteins. The S, M, and E proteins are embedded in the viral envelope, which is a lipid bilayer derived from the host cell membrane. The N protein, on the other hand, interacts with the viral RNA into the core of the virion ( Figure 1; Fehr and Perlman, 2015).
